lessons.name: Concurrency: Part 1
lessons.description: This video introduces key concepts of concurrency: concurrency itself, parallelism, race conditions, and the main thread. This video also demonstrates IslandCats, an app that benefits from application of these concepts.

keyTerms.name: Thread
keyTerms.definition: A series of instructions that run consecutively on a CPU to accomplish a particular task.

keyTerms.name: Concurrency
keyTerms.definition: The ability of threads to be executed discontinuously to enable sharing of limited CPU resources.

keyTerms.name: Parallelism
keyTerms.definition: Performing work on multiple CPU cores at the same time to accomplish some task more quickly.

keyTerms.name: Race Condition
keyTerms.definition: Data corruption that results from different threads, acting in parallel, attempting to modify the same data structure. May result in an app crash and/or in an indeterminate program state.

keyTerms.name: Grand Central Dispatch
keyTerms.definition: Appleâ€™s battle-tested concurrency-and-parallelism library, also known as GCD or (less commonly) Dispatch

keyTerms.name: Swift Concurrency
keyTerms.definition: Apple's newer approach to concurrency and parallelism

lessons.name: Concurrency: Part 2
lessons.description: This video demonstrates use of Apple's concurrency framework, Grand Central Dispatch, in IslandCats.

keyTerms.name: DispatchGroup
keyTerms.definition: The GCD API for running units of work in parallel.

keyTerms.name: DispatchQueue
keyTerms.definition: The GCD API for making access to an object from different threads safe.

lessons.name: Concurrency: Part 3
lessons.description: This video demonstrates use of Apple's latest approach to concurrency, Swift Concurrency, in IslandCats.

keyTerms.name: withTaskGroup
keyTerms.definition: A Swift Concurrency API for running units of work in parallel.

keyTerms.name: Task
keyTerms.definition: Permits creation of a concurrent environment from a non-concurrent method, which allows calling methods using async/await from that method.

lessons.name: Concurrency: Part 4
lessons.description: This video gives the viewer an opportunity to apply concurrency concepts while learning about French regions and the climates of their capitals.

links.name: Concurrency Starter Bonus Project
links.definition: This is the starter bonus project for the concurrency crash course.

links.name: Concurrency Completed Bonus Project
links.definition: This is the completed bonus project for the concurrency crash course.

links.name: Weather API
links.definition: This API, from OpenWeather, provides "essential weather data, short-term and long-term forecasts[,] and aggregated weather data".
